Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery chalice-cup; turn to wall preserved inside at lower break; interior: narrow reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; exterior: top of lip glazed, rest reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Such sherds have been identified as kantharoi by some scholars and as chalice cups by others. The horizontal handle usually found suggests that these are chalice cups, though this has a modestly tall rim. According to Schlotzhauer such pieces have not been excavated at Miletus, though locally made chalices have been found.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.738) (phase 3)
